concept.title: Quick Start Step 4:
concept.shortdesc: During this step you will use Terraform to create a cluster on .

strow.stentry:
Deploying a Docker Image
Decompress the .tar.gz file into a convenient directory.
Navigate to the directory and ensure that it contains a .tfvars file. Your .tfvars file should contain the credentials and keys for your cluster.
Add the necessary information to the .tfvars file.For more information, see Terraform Variables.
Run the following command:terraform apply -var-file=<myVariables>.tfvars
Terraform creates the necessary security groups and VM instances, installs Docker, and the installs the Docker images required to run the NATS messaging system. After the Docker image is deployed as an instance on , the URL of your your core will be formatted using the xip.io wildcard DNS, for example, api.15.125.91.46.xip.io. You can find out the URL of in one of the following ways:
Run the terraform show command to see the xip.io address.
On the web interface, click Project Compute Instances , note the external IP address (listed under the internal IP address), and format it as follows: api.<external IP address>.xip.io
You can also view the container host security group by clicking Project Computer Access and Security .
